moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Nf3 c6 5: This was when I started feeling uncomfortable - on one hand this helps my queen get off the square that it's doing nothing at all, but my position is so cramped.
moves.13... Qc7 14. e4 Bd6 15. f4 c5: Some attempt to just break up the position, if I let these pawns keep squeezing the centre I don't think I'll have any play other than scrambling for a draw.
moves.16. Nxd7 Nxd7 17. Nb5 Qb6 18. Nxd6+ Qxd6: I was actually pleased about this move. It locks the position obviously, but capturing on d5 and opening up the e file looks very unpleasant for me. I don't really want to castle into Bxh7+, and if I don't castle my King is too exposed. This felt like breathing room.
moves.19... Qb6 20. Bxh7: Now this move doesn't worry me too much. It opens up possible attacks on h2, it's only a pawn that I might be able to recapture in the middle, and my King is safe purely because of the pawn lock.
moves.20... cxd4 21. Bd3 dxc4: Now I was quite excited. I thought I was getting the bishop (or a discovered check and the queen, but that seemed unlikely). For some reason had missed that the rook at C8 is hanging and I might not gain material after all.
moves.22. Kh1 Ke7: Making sure the rook isn't hanging, and vaguely hopeful I might be able to double up on the h or c files. Also getting my king off the white squares felt important.
moves.23. Bxc4: Originally my plan was Qc6, threatening the bishop but also pinning the G2 pawn for the h file attack (meaning that I can respond to h3 with Rxh3).
moves.23... Rh6 24. b3 Qc6: Not much of a threat now sadly, but still pinning the pawn at least.
moves.25. Qf2: I thought Rf3 was a better defence here. I didn't see any way of preventing the loss of material now.
moves.25... Rch8 26. Qg3 Nc5: I thought about Rxf2 immediately, but I figured you couldn't prevent that this move, so I'd see if I could get more pieces into the attack. Qxg2 doesn't seem to achieve a huge deal for White, so I left the pawn hanging.
moves.27. Kg1 Ne4: Trying to lock down the F2 square.
moves.28. Qf3 Rh6xh2: g3 is the only move that isn't checkmate I think, it was all a relatively easy line to calculate from here as there it was a one way road for the rest of the game.
